triples.name: Fitness landscape
triples.relevance: The paper quantifies how fitness effects of mutations vary across genetic backgrounds and community composition, analyzing the adaptive landscape concept.

triples.name: Mutation
triples.relevance: The paper measures fitness effects of all possible mutations available to E. coli strains using transposon knockouts.

triples.name: Epistasis
triples.relevance: The paper explicitly analyzes how epistatic effects combine with ecological effects to shape the adaptive landscape.

triples.name: Escherichia coli
triples.relevance: E. coli is the organism studied in the Long-Term Evolution Experiment where the two ecotypes emerged.

triples.name: Transposable element
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using genome-wide barcoded transposon libraries as a method to measure fitness effects of gene knockouts.

triples.name: Gene knockout
triples.relevance: The paper measures invasion fitness effects of all possible gene knockouts in coexisting bacterial strains.

triples.name: Fitness (biology)
triples.relevance: The paper quantifies fitness effects of mutations and analyzes how fitness varies across different ecological conditions.

triples.name: Adaptation
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes evolutionary adaptation dynamics and how patterns of adaptation shift over time in the bacterial community.
